title: [Large-scale] Training and Game Optimization Course for Team Sport Skill Acquisition

context.prior_knowledge: Basic team sports experience and fundamental understanding of exercise physiology
context.additional_context: Delivers mobile-based training strategies to improve the efficiency of acquiring team sports skills for in-service secondary educators, emphasizing the design of activities that closely resemble actual game scenarios.

learning_goals: Participants can distinguish and explain three or more types of training-form and playing-form activities based on team sport skill acquisition theory.
Participants can apply a seasonal (pre-season/in-season) team sport training time allocation strategy (60:40 ratio) to real educational settings.
Participants can develop and measure two or more effectiveness evaluation metrics for team sport training design using mobile learning tools.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
